results.title: Born to build
results.brief_description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. Fascinated as a child with size and strength and an addiction to Marvel comics Alex finally starting pumping iron at the age of 16 and became hooked. Follow his journey in this humourous comic book style presentation as he lifts those weights and pumps that iron to build the perfect body.
results.description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Indelible impressions
results.brief_description: A family of women – they share pride and a passion for life; a love for dancing, talking and eating and each woman has left an indelible impression on those of the next generation. In this story Jade shares her memories and thoughts with the newest and youngest member in the family, her niece, and poses the question, “Will the women of our family leave an indelible mark on you just as they did on me?”

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Kylie
results.brief_description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.
results.description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Just like dad
results.brief_description: Gemma’s dad, an old rocker from way back, is passionate about music and anything and everything that is remotely connected to music. This addiction comes to a head when dad discovers Ebay on the home computer. Searches and purchases; Ebay has taken over his life. Worse still, Ebay the enemy is now growing on Gemma. She is her father’s daughter! Uses stills and animation.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]
results.brief_description:
Western Stories: Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.

results.title: The Way I see things
results.brief_description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.
results.description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Happy birthday
results.brief_description: Touching dedication to a mother by her eldest child, her only son. Scott talks of his close relationship with his mum, of their journey together through dark times, of change and survival and finally a second chance at life, love and family.

results.title: Two worlds: one me
results.creator_credit: Elinor Moshe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: iFavourite
results.creator_credit: Peter Ngo, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A glimpse into Peter Ngo’s world of techno music, video games, video editing and fun in the sun at the Alpine School. To Ngo’s mind, doing what you enjoy is the path to happiness and finding yourself.
